page.title: 08N. Bransholme, history.
page.content:
Bransholme was started in the late {1960's}as part of the Government re-housing program. Families where moved from the older areas around the fish docks in West and the dockland of East Hull.
Many of the older parts of Hull had been damaged during the heavy bombing raids of the{1939-45 war}and were considered top be irreparable. The original estate was built to cater for {35,000}people, but cut-backs in the 80's lead to part of the Northern Estate being left unbuilt.
Lack of funds and poor planning also lead to delays of many ammenities for the Northern section of the estate of some{5,000}people.
